ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: This class added nothing to my education. This was supposed to be a âcapstoneâ on my time here at FES, and all I did was rewrite poorly written documents produced by my client and my partner, occasionally conducting free research (i.e. Google search) for my client. This could have been done by a high school student. It was an extremely frustrating, worthless experience, made even worse by the fact that it took up valuable time in my final semester.I hated, hated, hated this class. Occasionally the speakers were ok. The class material was redundant with other courses I took at SOM. This class is everything that is wrong with FES.
I enjoyed very much this class. Maureen Burke was an excellent professor and brought great speakers.

This was a terrible course. It was a complete waste of time and a bad excuse for a capstone. I felt like a 3rd grader, required to work that I know is simply to keep me busy rather than really teach me something new. That is not what a graduate school class should consist of. It should be seriously re-vamped before being offered again.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The second half of my project was interesting. My client was nice.
The speakers and the projects we were assigned. The importance that Maureen gave to proper business writing was very helpful.

Nothing. The course is really good in theory, but completely fails in practice. I learned nothing. In fact, I felt like I was unable to use knowledge I had because of the poorly constructed structure of the class. In theory, consulting projects are a great idea but the course made this more like one long, drawn out, elementary school project rather than any sort of professional consulting project.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Make previous professional work experience a prerequisite.
Maybe the professor could remind the calendar of deadlines more frequently to avoid confusion. More exchange among student groups would have been very good.

The guest speakers were awful. They spoke to the class as though we had never heard of sustainability before, regardless of the fact that we are getting graduate degrees at a school of environmental studies. They were often redundant and never interesting. The class meeting times would be better spent working on developing consulting skills rather than listening to the worst speakers to ever talk at FES. Additionally, the professor seems completely unengaged. It is as though she created the curriculum many years ago and cannot be bothered to adjust it. The course requirements should be customized for each project (there are not many) rather than uniform for all. How was she a consultant?? She makes the worst powerpoint decks.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The lectures were terrible. Several speakers covered similar topics which were far too basic for the audience. How have these speakers been invited back each semester? They add no value.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: It was more of an intro class than a capstone class.
The course was very useful for someone like me with interests in sustainability consulting.

It doesn't. I learned nothing. I felt that skills that I had that would have been useful to the project and the client were not utilized because of the inane structure of the course and its silly requirements.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: One of the capstone classes.
Required
Because I thought it would prepare me well for a professional career in business consulting.

To fulfill the capstone requirement for the MEM degree. I actually feel cheated out of a critical portion of my education. I wish I had been forced to do a masters project rather than take this class. I learned nothing and really feel like I missed out.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: No.
Yes

No. I thought I would learn more about consulting and did not. I especially thought I would learn about environmental consulting and really did not. This class is poorly marketed and should be better explained as a hands-off project for people who want a somewhat easy class.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: My partner had good ideas and was efficient. But her English skills were really poor,and most of the project involved writing long reports. I felt unfairly burdened with the writing portion. Maybe two people is too few for this class (other groups had 4 people).
Working in a group is again, good in theory. However, the course requirements made the group work in an inefficient manner.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Don't take it.
To chose well your team member and the project
Unless there is a project that you are really dying to work on, do not take this course.
